means: 无想像力的，无灵感的，枯燥的

sentence.Network_en: Food in the dining car was adequate, if uninspired.
sentence.Network_cn: 餐车里的食品虽然量足够多，但花样太少。
这个剧本极其没有创意。

sentence.Network_en: There was no one who was uninspired.

RelatedPhrase.word: says that the artwork is uninspiring

list.key: says that the artwork is uninspiring
list.abs: He says that the artwork is uninspiring and old fashioned., 他说艺术品没有感染力 , 而且过时了.
He says that the artwork is uninspiring and old fashioned., 他说艺术品没有感染力 , 而且过时了.

entry.tran: 缺乏创造力的；单调乏味的
entry.def: If you describe something or someone as uninspired, you are criticizing them because they do not seem to have any original or exciting qualities.

example.tran: 这个剧本极其没有创意。
诚实正直但却缺乏创见的领袖

means.word_mean: 1. having no intellectual or emotional or spiritual excitement;
2. deficient in originality or creativity; lacking powers of invention;

auth_sentence.content: Students complain that their education is factory style and uninspired.
auth_sentence.res_content: Students complain that their education is factory style and uninspired.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Students complain that their education is factory style and uninspired.

auth_sentence.content: Even the most uninspired funeral can be inspirational.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even the most uninspired funeral can be inspirational.

auth_sentence.content: Even so, he remained an uninspired student.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even so, he remained an uninspired student.
